question: HDL was called good cholesterol because:
exp: HDL Good and Bad cholesterol terminology was used earlier. Now these terms 'good' & 'bad' cholesterol are discarded. HDL was called good cholesterol because of reverse cholesterol transpo i. e. it takes cholesterol from peripheral tissue to liver. HDL conves this cholesterol into cholesterol ester with the help of enzyme LCAT-Lecithin Cholesterol Acyl Transferase. This enzyme transfers fatty acid from lecithin (a phospholipid) to cholesterol. Lecithin after losing fatty acid becomes lysolecithin (See fig below).

question: Bile acids are synthesized from:
exp: Bile acids are synthesized from cholesterol (by modification of side chain), which is synthesized from Acetyl CoA. Bile acids consists of Deoxycholic acid, Lithocholic acid and Chenodeoxycholic acid. Bile acids are more appropriately called bile salts Present in deprotonated form Made in liver (RLE is 7-a-Hydroxylase) Stored in gall bladder, Emulsify the dietary fat which increases the surface area.

question: Cholesterol is not a precursor for synthesis of:
exp: Cholesterol is a precursor for synthesis of: Vitamin D, Steroid hormones Bile acids Lipocoin/ Annexin, inhibitor of phospholipase A2 enzyme. Increased expression of the gene coding for annexin-1 is one of the mechanisms by which glucocoicoids (such as coisol) inhibit inflammation.

question: Which among the following is the function of cholesterol in the Plasmalemma:
exp: The fluidity of the lipid bilayer is decreased in 3 ways: (1) By lowering the temperature, (2) By increasing the saturation of the fatty acyl tails of the phospholipid molecules, and (3) By increasing the membrane's cholesterol content Cholesterol interacts with phospholipids containing unsaturated fatty acyl chains, compacting them and constraining their motion in bilayers, hence decreases the fluidity.
opa: Increase fluidity of the lipid bilayer.
opb: Decrease fluidity of the lipid bilayer
opc: Facilitate the diffusion of ions through the lipid bilayer
opd: Assist in the transpo of hormones across the lipid bilayer

question: Which of the following is not synthesised from mevalonate?
exp: Cholesterol synthetic pathway is also involved in the synthesis of many other impoant compounds such as: Farnesyl pyrophosphate and geranyl pyrophosphate - involved in prenylation of proteins. Dolichol - involved in N-glycosylation of proteins in endoplasmic reticulum. Ubiquinone (Q10) - is the electron carrier in the mitochondrial respiratory chain. Inhibition of ubiquinone synthesis is one of the reasons for statin-induced myopathy. Ubiquitin protein is not synthesized by any of the cholesterol synthesis pathway intermediate.

question: All of the following are true statements regarding the regulation of cholesterol synthesis, EXCEPT?
exp: Transcription of HMG-CoA reductase gene is regulated by a transcription factor known as sterol regulatory element binding protein (SREBP). Binding of this protein to DNA sequences known as sterol regulatory element (SRE) which is located 5' to the HMG-CoA reductase gene increases the transcription (option 1 is true). When the amount of cellular cholesterol is adequate, SREBP remains inactive in endoplasmic reticulum (ER) bound to SREBP cleavage activating protein (SCAP). Binding of SCAP to SREBP is facilitated by another transmembrane protein known as Insig (Insulin induced gene). SCAP is a cholesterol sensor. When cholesterol levels fall, SCAP escos SREBP to the Golgi complex In golgi, SREBP is cleaved by proteases. This releases the DNA-binding domain of SREBP which can go to nucleus and increase the HMG-CoA reductase transcription. Insig1 helps in degradation of HMG-CoA reductase by ubiquitin degradation system (Option 3 is true). Mevalonate is feedback inhibitor of HMG-CoA reductase (RLE of cholesterol biosynthesis)(Option 4 is True). Cholesterol synthesis is an anabolic pathways and anabolic enzymes are active in dephosphorylated state (Option 2 is false).
opa: Binding of SREBP to SRE enhances the transcription of HMG-CoA reductase
opb: HMG-CoA reductase is active in phosphorylated form
opc: Insig1 is involved in the degradation of HMG-CoA reductase

question: Enzyme common to cholesterol synthesis and ketone body synthesis:
exp: Enzymes common to cholesterol synthesis & ketone body synthesis are HMG CoA Synthase & Thiolase. HMG CoA Synthase (Option 2) is rate limiting step in Ketone Body synthesis. HMG CoA Reductase (Option 1) is rate limiting step in cholesterol synthesis. Beta hydroxy butyrate Dehydrogenase (Option 3) is only used in ketone body synthesis. Thiophorase (Option 4) is the first enzyme in ketone body utilization. First two steps of Cholesterol Synthesis are same as Ketone Body Synthesis but Cholesterol Synthesis occurs in Cytoplasm whereas Ketone Body Synthesis occurs in Mitochondria.

question: The main function of bile salts is:
exp: The main function of bile salts is Fat absorption. Bile salts help in the digestion and absorption of fats and also fat soluble vitamins as they increase the surface area for their absorption. Bile salts help in absorption of fat by micelles formation as bile salts are amphipathic in nature. Hydrophilic nonpolar lipids are in center of micelle and are absorbed. Here best answer is fat absorption. Also, bile salts help in excretion of bilirubin like substances.

question: Which of the following is the rate-limiting enzyme of bile acid synthesis?
exp: microsomal 7-a hydroxylaseis rate-limiting enzyme of bile acid synthesis The first intermediate in the synthesis of bile acids is 7a-hydroxycholesterol It is catalyzed by the enzyme 7a-hydroxylase, a microsomal CYP450 enzyme, which requires NADPH, oxygen, and vitamin C as co-factors.
